Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from four fragments) of North Ionian black-figure pottery dinos; interior: reserved save black on inside of rim; on top of rim multiple guilloche; exterior, originally slipped cream: slim tongues at shoulder join, band below; animal frieze on shoulder; opposed sphinxes part-preserved on left, lion facing right on the right; added red details, mostly evanescent; filling ornaments: dotted rosettes and strokes.
Curator's comments: 1888,0601.546 c-e are probably from same piece.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.407)
